trans-unit.source: Provides a control for viewing flow content in a continuous scrolling mode.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> shows content in continuous scrolling mode.
A similar control, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, shows content in page-at-a-time viewing mode.
Both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> are fixed to a particular viewing mode.

On the other hand, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> includes features that enable the user to dynamically choose between various viewing modes (as provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode> enumeration), at the cost of being heavier weight than <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>.
The following figure shows a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> control with its default [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
![Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-main.png "Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer")
By default, a vertical scrollbar is always shown, and a horizontal scrollbar becomes visible if needed.

The default [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> does not include a toolbar; however, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsToolBarVisible%2A> property can be used to enable a built-in toolbar.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> is the only allowable child element for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> element may host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> class.
Cancels any current printing job.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be decreased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.DecreaseZoom%2A> method decreases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be decreased; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be increased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IncreaseZoom%2A> method increases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level can be increased; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoomProperty"></xref> dependency property.
Executes the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.DecreaseZoom%2A> method decreases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> that hosts the content to be displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> that hosts the content to be displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Document"></xref> dependency property.
Toggles the **Find** dialog.
By default, Ctrl+F provides a keyboard shortcut for toggling the **Find** dialog.
The following figure shows the **Find** dialog on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> with default UI.
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-find.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog")
The default **Find** dialog includes a field for entering search text, as well as buttons for **Find Next**, **Find Previous**, and **Options**.
The following **Find** options are provided by default:
Match whole word only
Match case
Match diacritic
Match kashida
Match alef hamza
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a horizontal scroll bar is shown.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto"></xref> .
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility"></xref> dependency property.
Executes the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IncreaseZoom%2A> method increases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> property
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the control does not have focus.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> does not have focus; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsInactiveSelectionHighlightEnabled"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> has focus and selected text.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the text box does not have focus; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsSelectionActive"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether selection of content within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> is enabled.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` to indicate that selection is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsSelectionEnabled"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> toolbar is visible.
The following figure shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> toolbar.
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer Toolbar](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-toolbar.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer Toolbar")
By default, this toolbar is not shown.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` to indicate that the toolbar is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsToolBarVisible"></xref> dependency property.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical children of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
An enumerator for the logical children.
Gets or sets the maximum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

The maximum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 200.0 (a maximum zoom of 200%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the minimum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

The minimum allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 80.0 (a minimum zoom of 80%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
This method is invoked whenever <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint%2A> command is invoked.
Invoked whenever an unhandled <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ContextMenuOpening"></xref> routed event reaches this class in its route.
Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
This method has no default implementation.
You should still call the base implementation in case an intermediate class in the inheritance has implemented this method.

The purpose of this method is somewhat similar to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On* methods: it provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes with a class handler instead of an instance handler.
In this case the matching event is a routed event.

The implementation pattern of the On* methods is different for routed events because the routed event may have been raised by a child element, not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers, so your implementation will need to take the event arguments' source properties into account (and should not try to re-raise the event in most cases).
Subclasses of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> could choose to call private class handler methods when the event is received along the route.
One potential scenario is to take the arguments of the event and deliberately mark the event as handled.
Arguments of the event.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnKeyDown%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs"></xref> object containing the arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
This method is called whenever the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel> routed event fires.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnMouseWheel%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventArgs"></xref> object containing arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print%2A> command is invoked.
Called when a printing job has completed.
Invokes a standard **Print** dialog which can be used to print the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> and configure printing preferences.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] does not provide a **Print** button.
The following figure shows an example of a standard **Print** dialog.
Note that the specific appearance of the **Print** dialog may vary depending on the hosting computer's configuration.
![Screenshot: Print dialog box](~/add/media/flowdocrdr-print.png "Screenshot: Print dialog box")
Gets the selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Selection%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Gets or sets the brush that highlights the selected text.

You can specify the brush that highlights selected text in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> properties.
A brush that highlights the selected text.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref>.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> to 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is transparent and is not visible.

If you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> to 1.0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is opaque and the selected text is not visible.
The opacity of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush"></xref>.
The default is 0.4.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a vertical scroll bar is shown.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the current zoom level.

The zoom level is constrained by the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom%2A> properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current zoom level, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 100.0 (a zoom level of 100%).
Gets or sets the zoom increment.

The zoom increment is the percentage by which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level is increased or decreased when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> commands are executed, respectively.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current zoom increment, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 10.0 (zoom increments by 10%).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom"></xref> dependency property.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
A service object of type serviceType, or `null` if there is no service object of type serviceType.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Use the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Document"></xref> property to add a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> as the content child for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
